result.execSummary:
The defendant Albert James-Laon Valenzuela was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-THC (>1000-2500 grams), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to DNA sample, unless already provided.  Undergo any treatment, counseling or evaluation per agent.     If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
With huber/work release.  Transfer to Dane County jail, per jail rules.  No electronic monitoring, ATIP or any other release program allowed.  Jail to commence on or before September 19, 2014.
Consecutive to: any other sentences or commitments.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Albert James-Laon Valenzuela in court with attorney Peter D. Bear.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendation.  Attorney Bear agrees.  Defendant agrees and understands.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Early release from probation per agent.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.
Count 1:
4 years Probation, concurrent.
12 months Sauk County Jail, with work release.  Consecutive.  Transfer to Dane County jail approved, per jail rules.  Jail to commence on or before September 19, 2014 at 7:30 p.m.  (no elect. monitoring or ATIP)
DNA surcharge $250 ordered/sample, unless already provided.
Undergo any counseling, treatment and evaluation per agent.
AODA & treatment
$268.00 costs & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)
Count 2-6 dismissed/read in
Paperwork handed in court.
Felony admonishment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
Prelim. Hrg. waived, Rec'd copy of INFO/waived reading

Defendant Albert James-Laon Valenzuela in court with attorney Peter D Bear.  Sue M Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea.  Parties have an agreement and wish to set out plea/sentencing.  ADA Mueller states on the record the agreement ( No Contest to Count 1:  4 years Probation,  12 mos. SCJ, w/work release, May serve in Dane Co. but no ATIP, Provide DNA surcharge $250/sample, Undergo any counseling per agent, AODA & treatment,  $268.00 C/C  & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION),  May request terminate probation after 3 years if agent agrees,    Counts 2-6:  DISMISSED BUT READ IN)
Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 2  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on May 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Return date on June 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Albert James-Laon Valenzuela appeared by video means with Attorney Peter Bear. Prosecuting Atty Linda A Hoffman appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State advises defendant has counsel.  Received email notification from Attorney Peter Bear today.  Attorney has now appeared.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State request cash bond.  Time limits waived.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contac with H.R.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
